search_results.lyrics:
Worst Case Kid Lyrics[Chorus]
Dysphoria melts me when I get home
Try to loosen my shoes, she said, "leave it alone"
But I tighten her words around my wrists
Like I've only been hers, like I've only had this

[Verse 1]
Sitting by the river with the sky in her eyes
I always feel like a tourist, wanna know what it's like
I've been staring down the barrel of another life
Said, "I could've been a lawyer, we would've been fine then"
[Verse 2]
Walking around with my head down
I'm a worst case kid in a plague pit town
Standing at the stake, say, "I'm cool by mysеlf"
That I'm a liar in the end, I'm gonna need your help

[Bridge]
And look at you, a killеr with a jaw for news
I always feel like a tourist, only came here for you
I've been staring down the barrel of another life
You said, "I could've been your courage
We could've been, we could've been fine"
(We could've been fine)
(Could've been)

[Verse 3]
All of the ways that it's too late now
Wearing your clothes as the clouds came down
Calling my friends, said, "the witch is dead"
Cut through the park, tryna catch my breath

[Chorus]
Dysphoria melts me when I get home
Try to loosen my shoes, she said, "leave it alone"
But I tighten her words around my wrists
Like I've only been hers and we could've been fineYou might also likeEmbed

album.full_title: Flight Risk - EP by Tommy Lefroy
album.name: Flight Risk - EP

annotations:
But you left New York for bigger and better stuff
 And how could I ever be enough?

New York, which is known as one of the most exciting cities in the world. The person left this city for something better. This makes the writes question how she would ever be able to live up to his standards.
Charlie and the Hollywood five
This is likely a reference to the five people killed by followers of Charles Manson on August 9th, 1969.

album.full_title: Flight Risk - EP by Tommy Lefroy
album.name: Flight Risk - EP

annotations:
What can go wrong, will go wrong
 ’Cause bet you that it would
 So you stacked up the odds

This lyric plays with the idea of manifestation where your thoughts and words can manifest into real outcomes. However, on the negative side of that spectrum, when someone is consistently looking for bad things to happen, they will often forget to notice the good things.

search_results.title: Trashfire
search_results.lyrics:
Trashfire Lyrics[Intro]
Fuck

[Verse 1]
Hands pressed to your thighs as if you could protect them
From the thoughts that you've had that conspire against them
Even though you need them to get by
Last chance to be a kid with a cereal box
Had a dream in your head but you woke up and lost it
And you only get a few more candles
Before you're too old to try again
To be a wreck
To get the sympathy of friends who see that you're not there yet
But they say that you'll get there
[Chorus]
And then all of a sudden, you're a bad liar
'Cause you said that it would get better
But all of a sudden, it's a trashfire
And you can't put it out, can't put it out
All of a sudden, you're a hostage
To things you thought you wanted
All of a sudden, you're a hot mess
And you can't sweat it out, can't sweat it out
Oh, oh, oh

[Verse 2]
Gets tough being young
But you do it for kicks
Kinda hate how it tastes
But you eat it with chopsticks
Existentialist
You wanna know what all of this is
Four more months
It's just a season
Cut your loss
You'll start to think that
Things you have are things you'll lose
It's normal but it's not the truth

[Chorus]
And all of a sudden, you're a bad liar
'Cause you said that it will get better
But all of a sudden, it's a trashfire
And you can't put it out, can't put it out
All of a sudden, you're a hostage
To things you thought you wanted
All of a sudden, you're a hot mess
And you can't sweat it out, can't sweat it out
Oh, oh, oh
Oh, oh, oh
You might also like[Outro]
And all of a sudden, you're a bad liar
All of a sudden, you're a trashfire
But if anybody treats you like a hazard
You're the one with your thumb on the lighterEmbed

description.plain: Trashfire, the noun, is defined as “something that is very poorly done, a mess” this could be a reference to how Lefroy is feeling in times of growing up and learning to deal with self hatred and becoming an adult.

song.embed_content: Read “Trashfire” by Tommy Lefroy on Genius
song.title: Trashfire

album.full_title: Flight Risk - EP by Tommy Lefroy
album.name: Flight Risk - EP

body.plain: Trashfire, the noun, is defined as “something that is very poorly done, a mess” this could be a reference to how Lefroy is feeling in times of growing up and learning to deal with self hatred and becoming an adult.

annotations:
Kinda hate how it tastes
 But you eat it with chopsticks
Tommy Lefroy might be using this as a metaphor to suggest how sometimes even when you’re not a fan of the experience you’re going through, you romanticize it and find ways to make it feel better.

All of a sudden, you’re a hostage
 To things you thought you wanted
This may refer one first experiencing the consequences of their own actions

Hands pressed to your thighs as if you could protect them
 From the thoughts that you’ve had that conspire against them
 Even though you need them to get by
Tommy Lefroy could be referring to the hormonal issue of one’s body image – wanting to change the way your body is, even though you can’t.

And then all of a sudden, you’re a bad liar
 ’Cause you said that it would get better
 But all of a sudden, it’s a trashfire
 And you can’t put it out, can’t put it out

Wynter Bethel and Tessa Mouzourakis toy with the phrase “it gets better” which young people are consistently told about adult life. However, some grow up to realize that’s not always true and adulthood can be just as difficult as one’s youth. They compare young adulthood life to a trash fire when one day, you wake up, and suddenly you’re not a kid anymore and you can’t “put out” that feeling of existentialism.

And you only get a few more candles
 Before you’re too old to try again
Here, the band may be referencing the fleeting nature of youth and how when we are young, it seems that any and all dreams could come true one day. But slowly, this mindset changes as we grow old.

search_results.title: Jericho Beach
search_results.lyrics:
Jericho Beach Lyrics[Verse 1]
I grew up when TV changed
Jesus saves and runs away
Carson got his fifteen minutes
For being friends with the kid who did it
And I have dreams where
I'm still trying to park at Jericho Beach

[Pre-Chorus]
I got out and ran away
Nobody came, nobody
[Chorus]
After all this waiting, seismic renovation
Gutted out the whole thing, but kept the presentation
So I figured I could probably do the same

[Verse 2]
You pick me up, it's far away
You need me for the carpool lane
I'm obsessed with what you're saying
"Take me out tonight" is playing
And I can't believe you
And you won't convince me either way

[Pre-Chorus]
I'll be yours until we're dead
You said it first, you said it

[Chorus]
After all this waiting, I was gonna save it
I was only practice, you were gonna waste it
So I figured I should wake up and walk home

[Bridge]
But the pavement is a portal
Then I'm sixteen, and I don't know
How to handle being mortal
Being rivals on the ride home
Staying somewhere that you don't know
But I'm still trying
And I'm still trying
And I'm still trying
You might also like[Outro]
I thought you wanted me this way (And I'm still trying)
And I'm still trying
I thought you wanted me this way
(I thought you wanted me this way)
I thought you wanted me this way
(I thought you wanted me this way)
I thought you wanted me this way
I thought you wanted me this way
I thought you wanted me this wayEmbed

description.plain:
Wynter had this to say about this song:

“Sometimes you meet someone and you know they’re going to change your life. I met Tessa in 2017. We had never lived in the same city, but it felt like we’d always been friends. We started this band as a joke, and it has been funny. In some ways it feels like a second chance at a coming of age, but this time a bit braver. We wrote this song called Jericho Beach about the worlds we grew up in and how, when you’re a kid, everything feels heightened. The past few years have still felt like that for us. Our last record was about learning when to leave, to take a leap. Since then, we’ve been learning how to stay. To be there for each other through all of this. The steadfastness we’ve had to find in each other is what we want to offer the listener, too. That, and a chance to scream at the end with your friends. And there’ll be lots of that on the next record. This is Jericho Beach.”

song.embed_content: Read “Jericho Beach” by Tommy Lefroy on Genius
song.title: Jericho Beach

body.plain:
Wynter had this to say about this song:

“Sometimes you meet someone and you know they’re going to change your life. I met Tessa in 2017. We had never lived in the same city, but it felt like we’d always been friends. We started this band as a joke, and it has been funny. In some ways it feels like a second chance at a coming of age, but this time a bit braver. We wrote this song called Jericho Beach about the worlds we grew up in and how, when you’re a kid, everything feels heightened. The past few years have still felt like that for us. Our last record was about learning when to leave, to take a leap. Since then, we’ve been learning how to stay. To be there for each other through all of this. The steadfastness we’ve had to find in each other is what we want to offer the listener, too. That, and a chance to scream at the end with your friends. And there’ll be lots of that on the next record. This is Jericho Beach.”

song.embed_content: Read “Slick” by Tommy Lefroy on Genius
song.title: Slick

annotations: Learn how to rage before I die

In an interview with W Magazine, Tommy Lefroy stated that this line is a reference to “The Aeneid” by Virgil. “There’s a lot of imagery of armor and combativeness, this sense of a call to arms,” Mouzourakis explained.

album.full_title: Flight Risk - EP by Tommy Lefroy
album.name: Flight Risk - EP

annotations: Don’t worry the plane won’t go down out of Montreal
Tessa shared via Instagram that this song is about “flight anxiety, trusting the pilot, and trusting yourself.” She also mentions it’s about “friends… and learning to meet the days as they come”.
